intro: Niphantha, commonly known as the Indian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Niphantha has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in the spring.
